description: Proposed change of use of Office (Use Class E) to Residential (Use Class C3) with associated parking, refuse/recycling store and cycle rack
decision_conditions: Under Schedule 2, Part 3, MA.1. (1)(a) of Class M Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), prior approval is required and refused. The application site fails to comply with the vacancy requirements, with the premises understood to be in operation under Use Class D1 at the time of assessment. Insufficient evidence has been submitted by the applicant to otherwise demonstrate that the application site has been vacant for the required length of time.

Under Schedule 2, Part 3, M.2(1)(a) of Class M Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), prior approval is required and refused. The proposal would be contrary to, in particular, the aims and objectives of Policy DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy (2012) and Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) owing to its failure to provide satisfactory natural daylight/sunlight to the proposed habitable accommodation. There is no supporting technical evidence submitted as part of this application to otherwise demonstrate that the proposed accommodation would achieve adequate natural light ingress.

Under Schedule 2, Part 3, M.2(1)(a) of Class M Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), prior approval is required and refused. The proposal would be contrary to, in particular, the aims and objectives of the Nationally Described Space Standards (2015) and Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) owing to its failure to provide sufficient information / evidence to demonstrate that the proposed development would meet the required internal floorspace and the substandard floor to ceiling height across the proposed accommodation in line with internal space standards set out in Policy D6 of the London Plan 2021.

It has not been demonstrated through the submission of cogent evidence that, on the balance of probability, the building has been in a Class E use for a continuous period of at least 2 years prior to the date of the application for prior approval, contrary to Class MA.1. (1)(b) of Class M Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended)
